pr_title: Create user_institution table. Keyed by user_details_id rather than u…

timeline.bodyText: nit: I assume we want to explicitly import each lib instead of import *?
timeline.author: kuoyuchi

replies.bodyText: yes, that's part of the styleguide https://google.github.io/styleguide/javaguide.html#s3.3.1-wildcard-imports
replies.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: Fixed here and elsewhere. Was a default in my ide to change to wildcard after 5 imports
replies.author: wamills

timeline.bodyText: I think we want to add a prefix(institutionId+"/") as argument of list (which, on cloud console UI, would look like each institution having a directory in the singleton InstitutionBucket).
timeline.author: kuoyuchi

replies.bodyText:
Can a user belong to more than one institution?
I initially just ported over the other CloudStorageService from the enroll-mgmt service but when converting forgot to update. Fixed to use the institutionId.
I think I have more work to do on this though. I thought we could have the heroes top level bucket and then a bucket per institution within to have a true separation of institutions: https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/standard/java/googlecloudstorageclient/read-write-to-cloud-storage#cloud_storage_and_subdirectories
doesn't look like that is possible. I'll change to just search within a subdirectory
replies.author: wamills

replies.bodyText: We can assume a user belongs to a single institution for now because it's coming from results of a single choice question. It might change in the future but we don't have to build it now.
replies.author: kuoyuchi

replies.bodyText: sg, changed to search within a subdirectory
replies.author: wamills

timeline.bodyText: user_details_id is the primary key for the user_details table, right? I don't think you need to set referencedColumnName explicitly, I think it will pick that automatically.
timeline.author: karepker
karepker

timeline.bodyText: Also we might want to change the return type here because the name of the blob (removing institutionId prefix) would be the resource title displayed, so we might want to change the return type to something like a pair<string,string>.
timeline.author: kuoyuchi

replies.bodyText: I have a UserResourceBean that I'm checking in in pull #363. You should be able to use that.
replies.author: karepker

replies.bodyText:
Changed the return type to include the title and changed to use UserResourceBean a level up so we can still test some of the ByteArrayOutputStream logic. Can't create a fake StorageOptions without a new GCP test project. The local test version cannot lookup all contents in a bucket.
Thanks!
replies.author: wamills

timeline.message: Create user_institution table. Keyed by user_details_id rather than user_id (user_id is not a primary key in this table).
When UserDetailsBO is deleted UserInstitution is deleted.
Add component to read from the user_institution table and look up an institutions data from GCS.
Add more detailed test to show we can lookup UserInstitution by UserId.
Use institution_id in Cloud bucket lookup. Also some other cleanups, no wildcard imports, spring boot cleanups.
Use institutionId as a prefix for lookup.
Add user_institution make table command to sql startup script.
Make it obvious that the foreign key is the user_details_id column in user_details column.
Return content title from CloudStorageService and use the UserResourceBean as the return value of GetUserInstitutionResources.
Return content title from CloudStorageService and use the UserResourceBean as the return value of GetUserInstitutionResources.
Remove institutionId directory prefix from title and skip placeholder GCS files.
Use AUTO_INCREMENT for key of user_institution table.
